description: Multiple Features Dataset: Fourier coefficients. One of six datasets describing features of handwritten numerals (0-9) extracted from Dutch utility maps. This dataset contains Fourier coefficients of the character shapes, capturing frequency domain characteristics.
creator: Robert P.W. Duin (Delft University of Technology)
feature_description: 76 Fourier coefficients of the character shapes. These coefficients represent the frequency components of the digit contours, providing a compact representation of shape information in the frequency domain.
use_case: Handwritten digit recognition for document processing, postal automation, bank check processing, and form digitization

dataset_family.description: Part of the Multiple Features dataset collection
dataset_family.note: Corresponding patterns in different datasets represent the same original character

data_collection: Handwritten numerals extracted from a collection of Dutch utility maps, digitized in binary images
mathematical_background: Fourier coefficients provide rotation-invariant features and capture periodic patterns in the digit shapes
advantages: Fourier features are particularly effective at capturing smooth contours and periodic patterns in handwritten digits
ethical_considerations: Dataset represents Dutch handwriting styles and may not generalize to other writing systems or cultural contexts

citations.author: M. van Breukelen, R.P.W. Duin, D.M.J. Tax, and J.E. den Hartog
citations.title: Handwritten digit recognition by combined classifiers

original_source.creator: Robert P.W. Duin (Delft University of Technology)
original_source.publication: M. van Breukelen, R.P.W. Duin, D.M.J. Tax, and J.E. den Hartog: Handwritten digit recognition by combined classifiers

dataset_history: Data Collection: Handwritten numerals extracted from a collection of Dutch utility maps, digitized in binary images
inference_notes: Advantages: Fourier features are particularly effective at capturing smooth contours and periodic patterns in handwritten digits. Use Case: Handwritten digit recognition for document processing, postal automation, bank check processing, and form digitization
